abstract: The airlines are expected to announce on Monday that they agreed to merge in a deal valued at nearly $3.2 billion.
snippet: The airlines are expected to announce on Monday that they agreed to merge in a deal valued at nearly $3.2 billion.
lead_paragraph: 5:38 p.m. | Updated The parent company of United Airlines and Continental Airlines are expected to announce on Monday that they agreed to merge in a deal valued at nearly $3.2 billion,  Michael J. de la Merced and Jad Mouawad of The New York Times reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the discussions.

headline.main: United and Continental Said to Approve Merger
